ai.engine.kepoj.layers

Interface Layer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConvolutionalLayer, DynamicLayer, InputLayer, StaticLayer

    public interface Layer
extends Serializable
    Layer interface of a neural network. Each layer provides basic learning algorithms even if the neural network isn't going to be trained.
    Since:
    1.1

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void buildLayer(Layer previous)
      Builds a layer structure based on the previous layer.
      void doLayer(double[] data)
      Processes data through every neuron
      void findErrors(double[] errors, double[][] weights)
      Calculates neuron errors based on the next layer's errors and weights between them
      double[] getBias()
      Deprecated. 
      double[] getErrors() 
      Neuron getNeuron(int index) 
      double[] getOutputs() 
      double[][] getWeights() 
      int length()
      Returns count of the neurons on the layer
      void setOutputs(double[] outputs)
      Sets output values to the neurons
      void trainLayer(double[] outputs, double ratio)
      Updates neurons weights based on their errors

    • Method Detail

      • buildLayer

        void buildLayer(Layer previous)
        Builds a layer structure based on the previous layer. Usually, Layer must be built in the neural network class.
        Parameters:
        previous - layer object before current layer
        Since:
        1.1

      • doLayer

        void doLayer(double[] data)
        Processes data through every neuron
        Parameters:
        data - input data with the same size as length of previous layer
        Since:
        1.1

      • trainLayer

        void trainLayer(double[] outputs,
                double ratio)
        Updates neurons weights based on their errors
        Parameters:
        outputs - outputs values on the previous layer
        ratio - learning decreasing ratio
        Since:
        1.1

      • setOutputs

        void setOutputs(double[] outputs)
        Sets output values to the neurons
        Since:
        1.1

      • findErrors

        void findErrors(double[] errors,
                double[][] weights)
        Calculates neuron errors based on the next layer's errors and weights between them
        Parameters:
        errors - errors on the next layer
        weights - weights between current and next layers
        Since:
        1.1

      • getNeuron

        Neuron getNeuron(int index)

      • getWeights

        double[][] getWeights()

      • getErrors

        double[] getErrors()

      • getOutputs

        double[] getOutputs()

      • getBias

        @Deprecated
double[] getBias()
        Deprecated. 

      • length

        int length()
        Returns count of the neurons on the layer
        Returns:
        layer length
        Since:
        1.1
